data.title: AI counts all aircraft rearm buildings
data.body:
Currently the AI only counts `hpad` (Helipad) or whatever is the first entry of `RearmBuildings` for aircraft when deciding whether to build rearm buildings for aircraft, ignoring other entries such as `afld` (Airfield).

~~If count matching behaviour is unwanted for certain aircraft, then a `NeedsRearmBuilding`/`ShouldHaveRearmBuilding` field, `[Recommended]RearmBuildingRatio` field, or the like should be added.~~

data.title: Added stepless mouse wheel actor rotation to the editor
data.body: This had a hard-coded limit of 8 facings which would be sufficient for Dune II units, but not later Westwood game era sprites and especially not voxels.

data.title: Increased harvester search radii
data.body:
Even before performance of harvesters was improved, I felt the search radius was a little too low.

This PR slightly-tomoderately increases the search radii in all mods.

This should improve the situation in cases where #9256 doesn't help.

data.title: Added AI search for new resource patches avoiding enemies
data.body:
It is a similar check I removed from https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/pull/9144 however it doesn't care about the resource claim layer, because that will run in the FindResource activity limited radius fine grained path search so we can skip it. Running two path finder searches is expensive so this is only the last resort when the current patch has dried out, not the default for every AI harvesting operation.

This also  brings back the enemy avoidance check which has been removed in https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/pull/6986. I believe it didn't work, because it was comparing length of cell position with world distances. I fixed that when rebasing the code snippet.

Closes https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/issues/9232.

data.title: Add a game speed dropdown to the lobby options.
data.body: All the recent perf improvements have made it (hopefully) feasible to implement a game speed modifier by adjusting the timestep and order latency values.  This will need testing in real network games (not just toy tests) before we consider merging it.

data.title: Hard lock-up when a game is reloaded.
data.body:
This is a bit synthetic, but describe the problem:

Step to reproduce:
- start a single player mission (or skirmish)
- leave the game
- re-start a mission (or skirmish)

Problem:
- game freeze

Note:
- quitting the frozen game only seems possible by sending a SIGKILL to the `mono` process
- no usable logs seem to be produced

Environment: playtest-20150830 on Fedora 22

data.title: Allied 5a: Tanyas tale - Spy being detected.
data.body:
I'm not sure whether it's a gameplay issue, or just something I missed.

The description of the mission reads:

```
Your spy can move past any enemy unit, without being detected.
```

However, both soldiers and the flame tower are able to detect (and kill) the spy when he passes within their range. The flame tower locks the western entry, and the two soldiers prevent any entry from the south gate.

Version: playtest-20150830 running on Fedora 22

data.title: Badger planes interfere with move order
data.body:
When a badger plane is clicked with the move cursor, unit moves to badger's location and not to the cell under the cursor. This can be tested with Crate Test map: http://resource.openra.net/maps/4446/
## <bountysource-plugin>

Want to back this issue? **[Post a bounty on it!](https://www.bountysource.com/issues/26429871-badger-planes-interfere-with-move-order?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github)** We accept bounties via [Bountysource](https://www.bountysource.com/?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github).
</bountysource-plugin>

data.title: Add Version field to map.yaml
data.body:
Like on the resource center, maps should have versions. So it would be possible to distinguish different versions of the same map.
## <bountysource-plugin>

Want to back this issue? **[Post a bounty on it!](https://www.bountysource.com/issues/26429253-add-version-field-to-map-yaml?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github)** We accept bounties via [Bountysource](https://www.bountysource.com/?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github).
</bountysource-plugin>

data.title: Make rocks and trees HiddenUnderShroud instead of FrozenUnderFog
data.body:
This improves performance significantly when many trees and rocks are on the map and shroud/fog are enabled.

Should reduce the performance issues described in #9244.

data.title: Setting crate SelectionShares in yaml doesn't work.
data.body:
This happens when there are more than one crate actors.

This code in map.yaml doesn't work:

```
Rules:
    World:
        CrateSpawner:
            Minimum: 100
            Maximum: 200
            SpawnInterval: 1
            CrateActors: testcrate-hide, testcrate-reveal
    testcrate-hide:
        Inherits: ^Crate
        HideMapCrateAction:
            SelectionShares: 50
            Effect: hide-map
    testcrate-reveal:
        Inherits: ^Crate
        RevealMapCrateAction:
            SelectionShares: 50
            Effect: reveal-map
```

It only spawns testcrate-hide. But the following code works:

```
Rules:
    World:
        CrateSpawner:
            Minimum: 100
            Maximum: 200
            SpawnInterval: 1
            CrateActors: testcrate-hide, testcrate-reveal
            CrateActorShares: 50, 50
    testcrate-hide:
        Inherits: ^Crate
        HideMapCrateAction:
            Effect: hide-map
    testcrate-reveal:
        Inherits: ^Crate
        RevealMapCrateAction:
            Effect: reveal-map
```

Is this a bug?

data.title: Lower shocktrooper health
data.body:
(Had to create a new fork and PR as I am unfamiliar with keeping a forked repo synced.)

Result of the ongoing discussion on the forums and feedback from the previous closed PR; http://www.sleipnirstuff.com/forum/viewtopic.php?f=82&t=18117&postdays=0&postorder=asc&start=0 

This simply nerfs the shock-trooper health from 100hp to 60hp. They now die in one pillbox burst and from parabombs.

data.title: Hide-map and reveal-map crates don't affect "All Players" observer view.
data.body:
In bleed and playtest. When a player gets reveal-map crate, All Players view should show no shroud. But it does. And the reverse happens with hide-map crate.
## <bountysource-plugin>

Want to back this issue? **[Post a bounty on it!](https://www.bountysource.com/issues/26427222-hide-map-and-reveal-map-crates-don-t-affect-all-players-observer-view?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github)** We accept bounties via [Bountysource](https://www.bountysource.com/?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github).
</bountysource-plugin>

data.title: Change some arrays to sets
data.body:
In places where arrays were being treated as a set, just create a set directly. This reveals the intention of such collections better, and also improves performance by allowing set based methods to be used.

(The follow up of  #9181, #9245).

data.title: Load HashSets in OpenRA.Mods.Common/Warheads/Warhead.cs directly from MiniYaml
data.body: `OpenRA.Mods.Common/Warheads/Warhead.cs` used `HashSet<string>`s created from `string[]`s loaded from MiniYaml, but #9181 makes that separation unnecessary.

data.title: Don't treat trees like regular actors
data.body:
So it's pretty well known that maps with a very large number of trees (or any other type of actor of course) tend to introduce quite a bit of lag to games. But because trees are indestructible and unmoving, is there any way that trees could be treated more like terrain elements than actors in order to avoid the lag that they introduce?

Thanks.
## <bountysource-plugin>

Want to back this issue? **[Post a bounty on it!](https://www.bountysource.com/issues/26424778-don-t-treat-trees-like-regular-actors?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github)** We accept bounties via [Bountysource](https://www.bountysource.com/?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github).
</bountysource-plugin>

data.title: Fix first sequence frame of animations not showing when Tick is 40 or lower
data.body:
As mentioned in #7483:

> This is a high-level design flaw rather than a bug (...).
> The problem is that traits like WithMuzzleFlash unconditionally call Animation.Tick from their own tick method, and this gets called once before the first render frame.
> The way to fix that will be to add if (!firstTick) checks, which will require some additional state tracking in some cases.

data.title: Added ^SpriteActor and fixed remaining BodyOrientation regressions
data.body:
This _should_ fix all remaining potential crashes related to `BodyOrientation` / facing quantization.

Fixes #9234.

Please review and test carefully anyway.

data.title: Fix crash when aircraft is rearming at a helipad in TS
data.body:
Caused by both helipads missing an "active" animation.
TLDR - https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/pull/9240/files?w=1

data.title: Move actors outside of the desired footprint when placing a building
data.body:
What the title says.
Spiritual successor to #7800.
Closes #3682.

Tested with 3 clients in a 2v2 match (+ 1 AI) and couldn't get anything to break or behave exploit-y.
You **cannot** tell allied units to move. This is a very basic engine design choice to prevent exploits - orders are accepted only if the client that issued them is the one that has the owner of the order's subject. See [here](https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/blob/bleed/OpenRA.Game/Traits/ValidateOrder.cs#L37).

data.title: Red Alert: Corrects spelling in "Asymetric Battle" map.
data.body: Changes map name to "Asymmetric Battle".

data.title: Fixed BodyOrientation in 3rd Allies mission
data.body:
Fixed

> Actor type 'prison' does not define a quantized body orientation.

Another followup of #9004.

data.title: Fix indentation in OpenRA.Mods.Common/Traits/Air/Aircraft.cs
data.body: Indentation fix (spaces to tabs) for `OpenRA.Mods.Common/Traits/Air/Aircraft.cs` in its own PR as agreed by @pchote and @Phrohdoh.

data.body: I'm stuck in windowed mode and nothing is working to fix it  ...the in menu mouse stops at 1 inch before the setting and playgame buttens and then gives me my desktop mouse....

data.title: Removed harvester search radius restrictions
data.body: Closes https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/issues/9232.

data.title: AI harvesters don't search far away enough for new resources
data.body: https://github.com/Mailaender/OpenRA/commit/2a21c7d1f2f8f10578cb71ce07147886e1dbec55 has the downside that the AI harvesters will start running circles when the next ore patch is too far away. The FindResources has to increase the search range in those cases.

data.title: Remove RenderSimple
data.body: All traits inheriting or requiring it have been replaced by or adapted to `WithSpriteBody`.

data.title: Unhardcode Cursor definitions.
data.body: Unhardcode the Cursors and documentate them.
